meanings.definition: A book containing problems and exercises for students to complete.
meanings.sent1: The students brought their workbooks to class to practice math problems.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new set of workbooks for her language studies.
meanings.sent3: The workbooks were so challenging that the students groaned when they saw them.
meanings.sent4: Her workbook was a treasure trove of knowledge waiting to be unlocked.
meanings.sent5: The colorful workbook made learning fun and engaging for the children.

meanings.definition: A book used for recording information or data.
meanings.sent1: The scientist kept detailed records in his workbook for future reference.
meanings.sent2: She jotted down the meeting minutes in her trusty workbook.
meanings.sent3: The workbook was filled with so many notes that it looked like a rainbow exploded on its pages.
meanings.sent4: His workbook was a time capsule of all the experiments he had conducted.
meanings.sent5: The workbook served as a reliable log of all the expenses incurred during the project.

meanings.definition: A book designed to help individuals learn a particular subject or skill.
meanings.sent1: The workbook on gardening provided step-by-step instructions for planting flowers.
meanings.sent2: She used the workbook to improve her piano playing skills.
meanings.sent3: The workbook was like a personal tutor, guiding her through each lesson.
meanings.sent4: His workbook was a roadmap to mastering the art of photography.
meanings.sent5: The workbook was a valuable tool in her journey to becoming a skilled chef.
